newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia to set up free customs zone at Ulyanovsk airport.
newsitem.headline: Russia to set up free customs zone at Ulyanovsk airport.

text.p: The central Russian city of Ulyanovsk has approved a project for a customs free zone at Ulyanovsk international airport, a spokesman for the Volga-Dnepr airline company said on Friday.
Konstantin Rogov told Reuters in a telephone interview from Ulyanovsk that the company planned to set up an International Trade Centre and build four cargo terminals at the airport.
"The zone will also have a (road) transport company for door-to- door delivery within Russia and CIS," he said.
"We hope that the zone will begin to work with 40 tonnes of cargo turnover daily," Rogov said.
Volga-Dnepr was looking for investors. "We have first offers from Russian companies," he said, but gave no details.

AO Volga-Dnepr operates 12 cargo planes -- seven An-124s, three Il-76TDs, one An-12 and one An-32 freighter -- making regular international and domestic cargo flights. It also uses a Yakovlev-40 jet for regular passenger flights between Ulyanovsk and Moscow.
The company had sales of $87.2 million in 1995 compared with $87.8 million in 1994. Last year's sales volume is not yet available.
